description: From Latin clandestīnus (“secret, concealed”); compare French clandestin.

adjectives.description: clandestine (comparative more clandestine, superlative most clandestine)

entries.meaning: Done or kept in secret, sometimes to conceal an illicit or improper purpose.
examples: Synonyms: covert, furtive, hush-hush, secret, secretive, undercover; see also Thesaurus:covert

entries.meaning: (Freemasonry, of a person or lodge) Not recognized as a regular member.
